title: Debug Config
subtitle: Log and language debug template configuration

logPath.label: Log File Path
logPath.description: Debug log save path (relative to workspace root), defaults to .bitfun/debug.log

ingestPort.label: Ingest Server Port
ingestPort.description: HTTP server port for receiving web application logs

templates.description: When enabled, custom templates will override built-in logic. When disabled, system default templates are used.

javascript.postToIngest: Send logs to the ingest server via HTTP POST.
javascript.replaceData: Replace {DATA} with a JavaScript object expression.

python.appendNdjson: Append NDJSON logs directly to LOG_PATH in the workspace.
python.ensureAscii: Use ensure_ascii=False to preserve non-ASCII characters.
python.replaceData: Replace {DATA} with a Python expression (e.g., {"var": var} or locals()).
python.importOnce: Add the import statement once at the top of the file.

rust.appendNdjson: Append NDJSON logs directly to LOG_PATH.
rust.replaceData: Replace {DATA} with a Rust expression (e.g., {"var": var}).
rust.syncOnly: Use in synchronous code; for async code use tokio::fs.

go.iife: Use an immediately-invoked function so it can be inserted anywhere.
go.appendNdjson: Append NDJSON logs directly to LOG_PATH.
go.replaceData: Replace {DATA} with a Go expression (e.g., map[string]interface{}{"var": var}).

java.appendNdjson: Append NDJSON logs directly to LOG_PATH.
java.requireGson: Requires Gson (or Jackson as an alternative).
java.replaceData: Replace {DATA} with a Java object (e.g., Map.of("var", var)).
java.writeString: Java 11+ can use Files.writeString; older versions use Files.write + getBytes().
